name: 42 Macro
title: How Will Stocks React As The Labor Market Moderates From Here?
text:
Synopsis
The labor market's potential moderation could significantly impact stock markets in 2025, with a risk of asset crashes if the market fails to stabilize and continues to drive hawkish monetary policy.

Key Insights
- December jobs report was unexpectedly hawkish, with surprising non-farm payrolls and unemployment rate data
- Stocks and bonds sold off as investors anticipate a less supportive Federal Reserve stance
- Analysts do not expect the current private sector labor income growth to be sustainable
- The Federal Reserve (led by Powell) is likely to support the labor market if it deteriorates, especially in the first half of 2025
- Potential policy changes in fiscal and regulatory domains could alter the Fed's reaction function in the second half of 2025
- If the labor market fails to moderate, risk assets could crash in 2025
- Continued hawkish repricing could exacerbate US dollar strength and reduce global liquidity
- Analysts estimate the 10-year Treasury yield could exceed 5.5%
